results.title: Testing vision in the pre-school child
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
A child’s visual competence includes not only visual acuity but also his ability to attach meaning to what he sees. The tests begin at six months and various procedures are demonstrated with children at 2 1/4, 3 1/2, 4 1/2, 5 and 6 years

results.title: Terminus
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Impressions by John Schlesinger of a day in one London’s main railway stations - told with music, songs and half-hearted commentary. A historically significant account of Waterloo Station which has altered greatly to accommodate the Channel Tunnel trains. Music by Ron Grains. (Awards: British Film Academy Award - Best Documentary, Venice Golden Lion Awards)
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Schlesinger, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films

results.title: Ten times empty
results.creator_credit: I Wilson, J Tristram and Juniper Films
results.brief_description: A study of life in a Greek village community on the island of Simi, a barren rocky island lying in the Aegean Sea off the coast of Turkey, with particular emphasis on the surrendering of traditional means of livelihood because of changing economic circumstances. Migration is a central theme of the film, with special reference to Australia. Scenes of the island reveal that despite a lack of factories, farming and jobs, close cultural and community ties bind the 3,000 inhabitants together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: I Wilson, J Tristram and Juniper Films

results.title: Ten million strong
results.brief_description: Shows the different ways of life of the various racial groups in Malaysia, and demonstrates that Malaysia is divided more by the contrast between rich and poor than by racial prejudice.

results.title: Temperature, pulse and respiration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Demonstrates how to take the pulse, temperature, and respiration explaining how to accomplish these tasks methodically and pointing out the location where the pulse beat may be heard.

results.title: Television in your community
results.brief_description: A tour of a television station, showing activities in the studio, the control room and the film projection room. Describes the roles of the director, cameraman, studio engineer, floor manager, projectionist and editor. Discusses factors which influence program planning

results.title: Television in school
results.creator_credit: Bill Morton, Ray Dicks and Associated-Rediffusion
results.brief_description: Provides a general introduction to television programs for schools, and their use in both primary and secondary schools. Two headmasters speak of their experience of using the medium and the childrean are seen “following up” the programs both inside and outside the classroom. Valuable for the picture it gives of modern education, new schools, and for its revealing close-ups of children.

results.title: Teeth: their structure and care
results.brief_description: Explains the structure of teeth pointing out why they decay and the need for proper care. Dave is not fussy about his teeth and visits the dentist only when he has recurring toothache. The dentist explains the function of the different types of teeth in the mouth, the structure of a tooth and the ways in which decay begins and spreads. The film concludes by stressing the importance of eating proper foods, brushing the teeth regularly and consulting a dentist frequently.
